contentrichtext.text: {{primary sources|date=December 2011}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Rudy Trouvé | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = | alias = | origin = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1967|01|28|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Antwerp (city)|Antwerp]], [[Belgium]] | instrument = [[Guitar]] | genre = | occupation = [[Musician]], [[Artist]], [[Record producer]] | years_active = | label = [[Sub Rosa]] | associated_acts = [[Dead Man Ray]], [[dEUS]], [[Gore Slut]], [[Kiss My Jazz]], [[Lou Barlow]] | website = | notable_instruments = }} '''Rudy Trouvé''' (born 28 January 1967 in [[Wilrijk]]) is a [[Belgium|Belgian]] [[music]]ian from [[Antwerp (city)|Antwerp]]. In the early nineties he founded the [[Heavenhotel]] [[record label]] and released dozens of records since. Between 1993 and 1995 he was part of [[Deus (band)|Deus]], quitting the band in favour of focusing on his own solo career, exploring obscure music groups and temporary [[collaboration]]s. Since 1995, he scored most success with [[Kiss My Jazz]] and [[Dead Man Ray]], and recorded a split album with [[Lou Barlow]] on the [[Sub Rosa]] label. Rudy Trouvé is regarded highly as an improvisor; in jam sessions and experimental concerts he has shared the stage with [[Mauro Pawlowski]], [[Zeitkratzer Ensemble]] ([[Germany]]), [[Marc Ribot]] ([[USA]]), [[Pierre Bastien]], [[Pierre Berthet]], members of [[DAAU]], [[Zita Swoon]],... As a former student at St-Lukas in [[Ghent]], Rudy Trouvé is also famous for his artwork; figurative paintings and blow-ups which can be found on the record sleeves of most of his self-produced records. == See also == In Docs Place Friday Evening, 1996, Knitting Factory In Coffee We Trust, 1996, Knitting Factory In the Lost Souls Convention, 1997, Heaven Hotel In a Service Station, 1999, Heaven Hotel ==Selected discography== *Rudy Trouvé / [[Lou Barlow]] - ''Subsonic 6'' (Split album, 2000) *Rudy Trouvé - ''Une Chanson'' (EP, 2002) *Rudy Trouvé - ''1999 - 2002'' aka ''Rather quiet songs'' (2002) *Rudy Trouvé - ''Cartoon Moon'' (EP, 2002) *The Rudy Trouvé Sextet - ''2002 - 2003'' aka ''In an introvert but danceable mood'' (2004) *The Rudy Trouvé Sextet - ''Tu Sais'' aka ''The French EP'' (EP 2004 ltd. 100 copies) *Rudy and The Unforgettable Wally's - ''We met on an airport and went through tape'' (CDR 2007) *The Rudy Trouvé Septet - ''Songs and Stuff Recorded Between 2003 and 2007 Part One'' (2007) *The Rudy Trouvé Septer - ''Songs and Stuff Recorded Between 2003 and 2007 Part Two'' (2009) *The Rudy Trouvé Septet - ''Allright'' (EP, 2009) *The Rudy Trouvé Septet - ''2007 - 2009'' (2009) ==Band history== * [[Dead Man Ray]] * [[Deus (band)|Deus]] * [[Gore Slut]] * [[Kiss My Jazz]] * [[The Love Substitutes]] * Rudy Trouvé Sextet/Septet * Rudy and the Unforgettable Wally's == References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * http://www.deadbeattown.com/ * http://www.heavenhotel.be/ {{Deus}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Trouve, Rudy | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Belgian guitarist | DATE OF BIRTH =28 January 1967 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Wilrijk]], [[Belgium]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Trouve, Rudy}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Wilrijk]] [[Category:Belgian rock guitarists]] {{Belgium-musician-stub}} {{Guitarist-stub}}
